title: Rams DE William Hayes commits to helping the homeless of Los Angeles
text:
Rams DE William Hayes commits to helping the homeless of Los Angeles Rams DE William Hayes commits to helping the homeless of Los Angeles By Tanya Ray Fox 4 hours ago 6 shares By: Tanya Ray Fox | 4 hours ago 
In November of 2016, Forbes estimated that of the approximately 550,000 homeless people living in the United States, one-in-five live in either New York City or Los Angeles. 
The total number of homeless in Los Angeles according to their cited survey was 43,853. That astounding number is double the entire population of the L.A. city of Calabasas. Related: Aaron Donald won $51K for Make a Wish Foundation in Madden Tournament 
While the staggering statistics help us to grasp the seriousness of the issue, the homeless should not be defined by just numbers. Unfortunately though, even the most well-intentioned often use that as a crutch to spread awareness without ever attaching real people to the crisis. 
That’s why it’s so moving to see the personal touch that Rams defensive end William Hayes is putting into his journey to aid the homeless population of Los Angeles. Related: Fellow Rams DE William Hayes brought Robert Quinn home from hospital 
Hayes founded the Big Play Hayes Foundation in 2016, and according to the foundation’s mission statement , it’s really all about spreading hope and love to those in our community who have been neglected. 
“The Big Play Hayes Foundation is all about spreading hope. We work with kids in difficult situations and adults who are experiencing homelessness. My focus for the foundation is to be a support system for the people we serve and to make a positive impact in each of their lives.” 
On Tuesday, the team posted this poignant video in which Hayes discusses his desire to use his platform to make changes for the homeless in L.A. He also takes on the role of Santa, bringing gifts to children who otherwise wouldn’t have received any. William Hayes remembers the forgotten families of the L.A. homeless community #SantaHayes pic.twitter.com/c1hTqGR3JS 
— Los Angeles Rams (@RamsNFL) January 3, 2017
